biogHist.abstract: The Care for Children Advisory Committee was established in 1999 to provide advice on matters relating to the out of home 'care' sector to the departments responsible for child welfare in Western Australia. The committee ceased operating in February 2002.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee (1994 - 1998)
Department for Family and Children's Services, State of Western Australia (1995 - 2001)

descriptiveNote.p: The Care for Children Advisory Committee advised the Department for Family and Children's Services on matters relating to the out of home care sector in Western Australia.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Department for Community Development, State of Western Australia (2001 - 2007)

descriptiveNote.p: The Care for Children Advisory Committee advised the Department for Community Development on matters relating to the out of home care sector in Western Australia.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Children and Young People in Care Advisory Committee (2002 - 2003?)

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Care for Children Advisory Committee', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,
Consultative and advisory committees on residential care for children 1977 to 2003

archref.repository: Dr Debra Rosser, Blair Fox Pty Ltd, unpublished manuscript
archref.unittitle: Consultative and advisory committees on residential care for children 1977 to 2003
archref.abstract: 'Consultative and advisory committees on residential care for children 1977 to 2003' is a copy of an unpublished manuscript prepared by Dr Debra Rosser in 2004. It gives an overview of a number of consultative and advisory committees established to inform the Minister and Departments responsible for child welfare in Western Australia. Committees named in the document are the Interim Committee on Residential Child Care (1977-1980); the Consultative Committee on Residential Child Care (1981-1990); the Consultative Committee on Out of Home Care (1991-1993); the Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee (1994-1998); the Care for Children Advisory Committee (1999-2002); and the Children and Young People in Care Advisory Committee (2003).
